janus package¶

Submodules¶

janus.aqmmm module¶

class janus.aqmmm.AQMMM(param, qm_wrapper, mm_wrapper, class_type)¶

Bases: abc.ABC, janus.qmmm.QMMM

AQMMM super class for adaptive QMMM computations. Inherits from QMMM class.

compute_COM(atoms)¶

Computes the center of mass of a specified group

atoms : a list of indices defining the group
to compute the COM for

xyz, atom_weight, weight_ratio xyz: an numpy array of the COM coordinates atom_weight: a dictionary with the indices of each atom in the

group and the atomic weight for each atom
weight_ratio: a dictionary with the indices of each atom in the
group and the weight ratio of each atom to the total weight of the group (sum of all atomic weights)

xyz, atoms, weights = compute_COM([0,1,2])

compute_lamda_i(r_i)¶

Computes the switching function and the derivative of the switching function defined as a 5th order spline:

lamda_i = -6x^5 + 15x^4 - 10x^3 + 1 and d_lamda_i = -30x^4 + 60x^3 - 30x^2

where x is the reduced distance (r_i - rmin)/(rmax - rmin) of buffer group i

r_i: float in angstroms of the distance between the
qm center and the COM

lamda_i, d_lamda_i as unitless floats

l, dl = compute_lamda_i(0.234)

compute_zero_energy()¶
define_buffer_zone(qm_center)¶

Gets the buffer groups in the buffer zone based on a distance partitioning scheme, saves each buffer group as a Buffer object, and saves all buffer groups in the dictionary self.buffer_groups. For water as a solvent, considers the whole water molecule as a buffer group. Need to generalize for all solvents

qm_center: a list of the indicies that make up the qm center

None

define_buffer_zone([0])

find_buffer_atoms(qm_center)¶
get_Rmax()¶

function to return self.Rmin

None

self.Rmax: float for the distance from qm center to
outer limit of buffer zone in angstroms

rmax = get_Rmax()

get_Rmin()¶

function to return self.Rmin

None

self.Rmin: float for the distance from qm center to
inner limit of buffer zone in angstroms

rmin = get_Rmin()

get_buffer_info()¶

Computes the distance r_i for each buffer group i between the qm_center and the COM of buffer group i and the computes lamda_i and d_lamda_i for that buffer group

None

None

get_buffer_info()

get_zero_energy()¶
nm_to_angstrom = 10.0¶
partition(info)¶
run_aqmmm()¶
run_qmmm(main_info)¶

Updates the positions and topology given in main_info, determines the partitions to be computed, for each partition, determines the QM/MM energy and gradients, then interpolates all partitions using specified adaptive QM/MM scheme

main_info: a dictionary containing the energy and forces
for the whole system, obtained from mm_wrapper

None

run_qmmm(main_info)

set_Rmax(Rmax)¶

function to set self.Rmax

Rmax: float for the distance from qm center to
outer limit of buffer zone in angstroms

None

set_Rmax(.50)

set_Rmin(Rmin)¶

function to set self.Rmin

Rmin: float for the distance from qm center to
inner limit of buffer zone in angstroms

None

set_Rmin(.35)

janus.das module¶

class janus.das.DAS(param, qm_wrapper, mm_wrapper)¶

Bases: janus.aqmmm.AQMMM

compute_lamda_i(r_i)¶

Computes the switching function of the Hot-Spot method and overrides the compute_lamda_i function from the AQMMM class

r_i: float in angstroms of the distance between the
qm center and the COM

lamda_i as an unitless float, None for the value of d_lamda_i

l, dl = compute_lamda_i(0.234)

get_combos(items=None)¶

Gets all combinations of a given list of indices

items: list of indices to get combinations for

List of all possible combinations

combos = get_combos([1,2])

In this case, combos will return [(1), (2), (1,2)]

partition(qm_center=None, info=None)¶

Finds the partitions as required by the PAP method and saves each partition as a system object. Saves all systems in the dictionary self.systems

qm_center: list of atoms that define the qm center,
default is None

None

partition([0])

run_aqmmm()¶

Interpolates the energy and gradients from each partition according to the PAP method

janus.openmm_wrapper module¶

class janus.openmm_wrapper.OpenMM_wrapper(param)¶

Bases: janus.mm_wrapper.MM_wrapper

A wrapper class that calls OpenMM to obtain molecular mechanics information and take steps in a molecular dynamics simulation. Class inherits from MM_wrapper.

compute_mm(topology, positions, include_coulomb='all', initialize=False, return_system=False, return_simulation=False, link_atoms=None, minimize=False)¶

Gets information about a set of molecules as defined in the pdb, including energy, positions, forces

topology: an OpenMM topology object positions: an OpenMM Vec3 vector containing

the positions of the system in nm
include_coulomb: whether to include coulombic interactions.
‘all’ (default) includes coulombic forces for all particles, ‘no_link’ excludes coulombic forces for link atoms, ‘only’ excludes all other forces for all atoms, None excludes coulombic forces for all particles.

initialize: bool to specifying whether the main system is being initialized. return_system: a bool to specify whether to return the OpenMM system object.

Default is True.
return_simulation: a bool to specify whether to return the OpenMM simulation object.
Default is True.
link_atoms: if included as a list with include_coulomb=’no_link’, specifies which
atoms to remove coulombic forces from. Default is None.

system, simulation, state state: A dictionary with state information system: OpenMM system object returned unless return_system=False simulation: OpenMM simulation object returned unless return_simulation=False

system, simulation, state = compute_mm(top, pos) state = compute_mm(top, pos, return_simulation=False, return_system=False)

create_modeller(qm_atoms, keep_qm=None)¶

Makes a OpenMM modeller object based on given geometry

keep_qm : a bool of whether to keep the qm atoms in the
modeller or delete them. The default is to make a modeller without the qm atoms

A OpenMM modeller object

modeller = self.make_modeller() modeller = self.make_modeller(keep_qm=True)

create_new_residue_template(topology)¶

Create a new OpeMM residue template when there is no matching residue and registers it into self.forcefield forcefield object. Note: currently, if there is unmatched name, currently only checks original

unmodified residue, N-terminus form, and C-terminus form. This may not be robust.

topology: an OpenMM topology object

None

create_new_residue_template(topology)

create_openmm_simulation(openmm_system, topology, positions)¶

Creates an OpenMM simulation object given an OpenMM system, topology, and positions

openmm_system: OpenMM system object topology: an OpenMM topology object positions: an OpenMM Vec3 vector containing

the positions of the system in nm

an OpenMM simulation object

create_open_simulation(openmm_sys, top, pos) create_open_simulation(openmm_sys, pdb.topology. pdb.positions)

create_openmm_system(topology, include_coulomb='all', link_atoms=None, initialize=False)¶

Calls OpenMM to create an OpenMM System object give a topology, forcefield, and other paramters as given in input

topology: an OpenMM topology object include_coulomb: whether to include coulombic interactions.

‘all’ (default) includes coulombic forces for all particles, ‘no_link’ excludes coulombic forces for link atoms, ‘only’ excludes all other forces for all atoms, None excludes coulombic forces for all particles.
link_atoms: if included as a list with include_coulomb=’no_link’, specifies which
atoms to remove coulombic forces from. Default is None.
initialize: bool to specifying whether the main system is being initialized.
If True, this will create a custom force to store qmmm forces. default is false
TODO: need to put nonbond and nonbond_cutoff back but not doing for now

because need non-periodic system. Other parameters are also needed also, expand forcefield to take not openmm built in

but customized as well

An OpenMM system object

openmm_sys = create_openmm_system(topology) openmm_sys = create_openmm_system(top, include_coulomb=’no_link’, link_atoms=[0,1,2]) openmm_sys = create_openmm_system(top, include_coulomb=’only’) openmm_sys = create_openmm_system(top, initialize=True)

create_pdb()¶

Creates an OpenMM PDB object

mm_pdb_file: string of pdb file name

OpenMM PDB object

model = create_openmm_pdb(‘input.pdb’)

delete_atoms(atoms)¶

Delete specified atoms from an OpenMM Modeller object

model : OpenMM Modeller object atoms : list of atom IDs (int) or atom names (str) to delete

an OpenMM Modeller object

None

delete_atoms(model, [0, 3, 5]) delete_atoms(model, [‘Cl’])

equilibrate(num)¶
get_main_charges()¶

Gets the MM point charges for the system of interest

None

list of charges

charges = get_main_charges()

get_main_info()¶

Gets the information for the system of interest

None

dictionary with information like energy and gradient for the system of interest

info = get_main_info()

get_state_info(main_info=False, energy=True, positions=True, velocity=False, forces=True, parameters=False, param_deriv=False, periodic_box=False, groups_included=-1)¶

Gets information like the kinetic and potential energy, positions, forces, and topology from an OpenMM state. Some of these may need to be made accessible to user.

simulation : an OpenMM simulation object main_info : a bool for specifying whether to return the topology of the system energy : a bool for specifying whether to get the energy,

returns in hartrees(a.u.), default is true.
positions : a bool for specifying whether to get the positions,
returns in nanometers, default is true

velocity : a bool for specifying whether to get the velocities, default is false forces : a bool for specifying whether to get the forces acting

on the system, returns as numpy array in jk/mol/nm, as well as the gradients, in au/bohr, default is true
parameters : a bool for specifying whether to get the parameters
of the state, default is false.
param_deriv : a bool for specifying whether to get the parameter
derivatives of the state, default is false
periodic_box : a bool for whether to translate the positions so the
center of every molecule lies in the same periodic box, default is false
groups : a set of indices for which force groups to include when computing
forces and energies. Default is all groups

A dictionary with information specified by parameters. Keys include ‘energy’, ‘potential’, ‘kinetic’, ‘forces’, ‘gradients’, ‘topology’

get_state_info(sim) get_state_info(sim, groups_included=set{0,1,2}) get_state_info(sim, positions=True, forces=True)

initialize(embedding_method)¶

Calls compute_mm to get information for the system of interest in its initial state and saves the simulation object and information dictionary returned by compute_mm

embedding_method: what embedding method to use for initialization.
If ‘Mechanical’, all forces are included If ‘Electrostatic’, all coulomic forces are excluded

None

initialize(‘Mechanical’) initialize(‘Electrostatic’)

keep_atoms(atoms)¶

Acts on an OpenMM Modeller object to keep the specified atoms in the MM system and deletes everything else

model : OpenMM Modeller object atoms : list of atoms to keep in an OpenMM Modeller object

None

keep_atom(mod, [0,1]) keep_atom(mod, [‘O’, ‘H’])

set_LJ_zero(OM_system)¶

Removes the Lennard-Jones (van der Waals) force from the system

OM_system : an OpenMM system object

None

set_LJ_zero(system)

set_charge_zero(OM_system, link_atoms=None)¶

Removes the coulombic forces by setting charges of specified atoms to zero

OM_system : an OpenMM system object link_atoms : list of link_atoms to set the charge to zero,

if link_atoms is None (default), the charge of all particles in the system will be set to zero

None

set_charge_zero(system) set_charge_zero(system, link_atoms=[0,1,2])

take_step(force)¶

Updates the system with forces from qmmm and takes a simulation step

forces: dict of forces(particle index: forces) in au/bohr to
be updated in custom qmmm force and fed into simulation

None

take_step(forces) take_step({0: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]})

write_pdb(filename)¶

Write a pdb file from an OpenMM modeller

mod : OpenMM modeller object filename : string of file to write to

None

write_pdb(mod, ‘input.pdb’)

janus.psi4_wrapper module¶

class janus.psi4_wrapper.Psi4_wrapper(param)¶

Bases: janus.qm_wrapper.QM_wrapper

A wrapper class that calls Psi4 to obtain quantum mechanical information. Class inherits from QM_wrapper.

build_qm_param()¶

Builds a dictionary of QM parameters from input options and saves as self.param

None

None

build_qm_param()

compute_energy()¶

Calls Psi4 to obtain the energy and Psi4 wavefunction object of the QM region and saves as self.energy and self.wavefunction

None

None

compute_energy()

compute_energy_and_charges()¶

Calls Psi4 to obtain the self.energy, self.wavefunction, and self.charges on each atom. This method for correlated methods. Note: think about passing in wavefunction instead of calling for energy and wavefunction

None

None

compute_energy_and_charges(system)

compute_energy_and_gradient()¶

Calls Psi4 to obtain the energy, Psi4 wavefunction object, and gradient of the QM region and saves as self.energy, self.wavefuction, and self.gradient

None

None

compute_energy()

compute_gradient()¶

Calls Psi4 to obtain the gradient of the QM region and saves it as a numpy array self.gradient

None

None

compute_gradient()

compute_scf_charges()¶

Calls Psi4 to obtain the self.charges on each atom given and saves it as a numpy array. This method works well for SCF wavefunctions. For correlated levels of theory (e.g., MP2), it is advised that compute_energy_and_charges() be used instead.

None

None

compute_scf_charge()

janus.qm_wrapper module¶

class janus.qm_wrapper.QM_wrapper(param, program)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

build_qm_param()¶
run_qm(geometry, total_elec, minimize=False)¶

Gets the energy and gradient from a QM computation of the primary subsystem

geometry: A string with the geometry information
for the QM region
total_elec: An int of the total number of electrons
present in the QM region

A dictionary with energy(‘energy’) and gradient(‘gradients’) information

run_qm(geom, 10)

set_external_charges(charges)¶

Sets the charges due to the MM point charges as self.external_charges

charges: a list with the charge and position(in angstroms) for all
particles outside the QM region

None

set_external_charges([[-.45, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0]]) set_external_charges(charges)

set_qm_geometry(qm_geometry, total_elec)¶

Sets the geometry for the QM region as self.qm_geometry. Also determines if the system is open shelled based on the number of electrons

geometry: A string with the geometry information
for the QM region
total_elec: An int of the total number of electrons
present in the QM region

None

set_qm_geometry(geom, 10)

janus.qmmm module¶

class janus.qmmm.QMMM(param, qm_wrapper, mm_wrapper)¶

Bases: object

compute_gradients(system)¶

Computes the QM/MM gradients TODO:RCD gradients need work

system: a system object that contains the gradients
of qm and mm regions

None

compute_gradients(system)

convert_trajectory(traj)¶

Converts an OpenMM trajectory to get topology and positions that are compatible with MDtraj NOTE: with more programs need to expand

traj: an OpenMM trajectory object

positions: a list of positions in nm topology: a MDtraj topology object

positions, topology = convert_trajectory(OpenMM_traj)

edit_qm_atoms(qm_atoms=None, solvent='water')¶

Cleans up the qm_atoms. If the definition of the primary subsystem cuts across a solvent molecule, will move the whole molecule in the qm_atoms if COM of solvent molecule in qm_atoms already, or delete parts of the solvent molecule from qm_atoms if COM of solvent molecule not in qm_atoms already

qm_atoms: A list of atom indicies corresponding to the atoms in
the primary subsystem. Default is None and uses self.qm_atoms
solvent: A str that identifies what solvent needs to be edited.
Only water supported for now(default)

edited list of qm_atoms

atoms = edit_qm_atoms() atoms = edit_qm_atoms(qm_atoms=[0,1,2])

electrostatic(system, main_info)¶

Gets energies of needed components and computes a QM/MM energy with a subtractive electrostatic embedding scheme

E(QM/MM) = E(MM no coulomb)_entire_sys - E(MM no coulomb)_primary_subsys
  • E(QM)_primary_subsys + E(MM just coulomb)_secondary_subsys
find_boundary_bonds(qm_atoms=None)¶

Identified any covalent bonds that the QM/MM boundary cuts across

qm_atoms: A list of atom indicies corresponding to the atoms in
the primary subsystem. Default is None and uses self.qm_atoms

None

find_boundary_bonds() find_boundary_bonds(qm_atoms=[0,1,2,3])

get_external_charges(system)¶

Gets the point charges of atoms from secondary subsystem for electrostatic embedding

system: a system object that contains the gradients
of qm and mm regions

A list of charges and cooresponding positions in angstroms as xyz coordinates

get_external_charge(system)

get_qm_geometry(qm_traj=None)¶

Uses the atoms and positions from a MDtraj trajectory object with just the qm region to obtain the geometry information

qm_traj: a MDtraj object describing just the primary subsystem,
default is None

out, total out: the str with geometry information in angstroms total: total number of electrons in the primary subsystem

geom, total_elec = qm_positions()

get_redistributed_positions(positions, bonds, mm)¶

Gets the positions for the redistributed point charges in the RC and RCD schemes

positions: a list of the positions bonds: a list of indices of all atoms (in secondary subsystem) bonded to M1 mm: the index of M1

List of positions for the redistributed charges

get_redistributed_positions(positions=pos, bonds=bond, mm=mm_index)

make_primary_subsys_trajectory(qm_atoms=None)¶

Creates a MDtraj trajectory object with just the primary subsystem, and adds in any link atoms Note: Currently adds just H as link atom, need to expand. Also, H is added

as a very specific H1 atom, or else the connectivity in the create_new_residue_templates function in openmm gets messed up and gives a “set of atoms match but bonds are different

error”
qm_atoms: A list of atom indicies corresponding to the atoms in
the primary subsystem. Default is None and uses self.qm_atoms

traj, link_indicies traj: MDtraj trajectory object link_indices: list of the link atom indices in traj

make_primary_subsys_trajectory([0,1,2]) make_primary_subsys_trajectory()

make_second_subsys_trajectory(qm_atoms=None)¶

Creates a MDtraj trajectory object with just the secondary subsystem

qm_atoms: A list of atom indicies corresponding to the atoms in
the primary subsystem. Default is None and uses self.qm_atoms

a MDtraj trajectory object

make_second_subsys_trajectory([0,1,2]) make_second_subsys_trajectory()

mechanical(system, main_info)¶

Gets energies of needed components and computes a QM/MM energy with a subtractive mechanical embedding scheme using the formula

E(QM/MM) = E(MM)_entire_sys - E(MM)_primary_subsys + E(QM)_primary_subsys

prepare_link_atom()¶

Saves the qm and mm atom associated with the bond being cut across the QM/MM boundary and computes the g scaling factor for the link atom.

None

None

prepare_link_atom()

main_info: a dictionary containing the energy and forces

janus.sap module¶

class janus.sap.SAP(param, qm_wrapper, mm_wrapper)¶

Bases: janus.aqmmm.AQMMM

compute_sf_gradient()¶

Computes forces due to the gradient of the switching function

None

Forces due to gradient of switching function as a dictionary

get_combos(items=None, buffer_distance=None)¶

A given list of indices is sorted by distance and the combinations is found based on distance order. See example

items: list of indices to get combinations for buffer_distance: dictionary with indices from items

and their distances from the qm center

List of all possible combinations

combos = get_combos([1,2,3])

If 1 was closer to the center than 2, and 2 closer to the center than 3, functions returns following: [(1), (1,2), (1,2,3)]

get_switching_functions()¶

Computes switching function for SAP computations and saves to each buffer group object

None

None

get_switching_function()

janus.system module¶

class janus.system.Buffer(ID)¶

Bases: object

A class to store information for buffer groups from aqmmm computations such as what atoms are contained in the buffer group, the switching function, COM coordinates, etc.

class janus.system.System(qm_indices, qm_residues, run_ID, partition_ID='qm')¶

Bases: object

A system class that stores system information such as energy, forces, and positions for each region of a system at a particular point Stores qmmm and aqmmm information as well.

compute_scale_factor_g(mm, link)¶

Computes scale factor g for link atom, RC, and RCD schemes. Note: r given in pmm but don’t need to convert because it is a ratio

need functionality for link atoms != ‘H’

qm: string of element symbol of the QM atom involved in broken bond mm: string of element symbol of the MM atom involved in broken bond link: string of element symbol for link atom

g, the scaling factor

g = compute_scale_factor(qm=’C’, mm=’C’, link=’H’) “”“
